Distributions

Distributions from flowjax.distributions.

class Distribution(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Module, ABC

Distribution base class.

dim: int
cond_dim: int
property conditional

Whether the distribution is an unconditional distribution or not.

sample(key: PRNGKeyArray, condition: Optional[Any] = None, n: Optional[int] = None) → Any[source]

Sample from a distribution. The condition can be a vector, or a matrix. - If condition.ndim==1, n allows repeated sampling (a single sample is drawn if n is not provided). - If condition.ndim==2, axis 0 is treated as batch dimension, (one sample is drawn for each row).

Parameters

  • key (KeyArray) – Jax PRNGKey.

  • condition (Optional[Array], optional) – Conditioning variables. Defaults to None.

  • n (Optional[int], optional) – Number of samples (if condition.ndim==1). Defaults to None.

Returns

Jax array of samples.

Return type

Array

log_prob(x: Any, condition: Optional[Any] = None)[source]

Evaluate the log probability. If a matrix/matrices are passed, we vmap (vectorise) over the leading axis.

Parameters

  • x (Array) – Points at which to evaluate density.

  • condition (Optional[Array], optional) – Conditioning variables. Defaults to None.

Returns

Jax array of log probabilities.

Return type

Array

__init__(dim: int, cond_dim: int) → None
class Transformed(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Distribution

__init__(base_dist: Distribution, bijection: Bijection)[source]

Form a distribution like object using a base distribution and a bijection. We take the forward bijection for use in sampling, and the inverse bijection for use in density evaluation.

Parameters

  • base_dist (Distribution) – Base distribution.

  • bijection (Bijection) – Bijection to transform distribution.

base_dist: Distribution
bijection: Bijection
dim: int
cond_dim: int
class StandardNormal(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Distribution

__init__(dim: int)[source]

Implements a standard normal distribution, condition is ignored.

Parameters

dim (int) – Dimension of the normal distribution.

class Normal(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Transformed

Implements an independent Normal distribution with mean and std for each dimension. loc and scale should be broadcastable.

__init__(loc: Any, scale: Any = 1.0)[source]
Parameters

  • loc (Array) – Array of the means of each dimension.

  • scale (Array) – Array of the standard deviations of each dimension.

property loc
property scale
class Uniform(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Transformed

Implements an independent uniform distribution between min and max for each dimension. minval and maxval should be broadcastable.

__init__(minval: Any, maxval: Any)[source]
Parameters

  • minval (Array) – ith entry gives the min of the ith dimension

  • maxval (Array) – ith entry gives the max of the ith dimension

property minval
property maxval
class Gumbel(*args, **kwargs)[source]
